page.title: 19All Saints Church.
page.content:
All Saints Church by Jonathan Langton
In 1861 the Jonathan Robinson School on the corner of Woods Lane and Church Road was enlarged and opened for divine service under licence from the Bishop of Chester.Before this Church of England families living in Cheadle Hulme had to travel to Cheadle Parish Church. The population was by this time growing and the schoolroom was not big enough,so a permanent church was agreed on.All Saints Church was opened in 1863.The first vicar of All Saints was the Rev.Charles Cummings. Within a year of the opening of All Saints the district was described as "rapidly improving,containing some handsome suburban residences".The increasing requirements of the neighbourhood induced the Lord of the
